intro: Ulmarronia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf ulmaria, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in swampy or seasonally flooded areas, thriving in moist, clay soils. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Ulmarronia lanceolata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
